applicability_reasoning: This regulation clearly applies to the document for several reasons: 1) The document describes a pension life cover scheme where Section 2.3 explicitly states 'The premium is a fixed amount unless an indexation or annual increase option applies to the policy, or if changes are made to the policy.' This indicates the premium may be subject to review. 2) Section 2.3 also mentions 'Cover amounts can be amended in the future in line with the employer's wishes.' This further confirms the premium may be subject to change. 3) The document is from AIB life, which is regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland (stated at the end of the document), making it subject to these regulations. 4) The document represents the type of insurance policy documentation that Regulation 337 specifically targets - one where premiums may be subject to review during the policy term. The regulation requires clear disclosure of potential premium increases and fixed premium periods, which is relevant to this pension life cover scheme's premium structure.
regulation_title: Information to be provided where premium may be subject to review
regulation_text: 337. (1) Prior to offering, recommending, arranging or providing an insurance policy where the premium payable by the consumer may be subject to review by the insurance undertaking during the term of the policy, an insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary sh all - (a) explain clearly to the consumer the risk that the premium may increase, and (b) provide the consumer with details of the time period for which the initial premium is fixed. (2) An insurance undertaking shall include a warning statement in the following format on the application form for an insurance policy of the kind referred to in paragraph (1), inserting the appropriate information in place of the instruction in square bracket s for that purpose: "Warning: The Premium [insert ‘may' or ‘will' as appropriate] increase after [insert period of time for which the premium is fixed]." (3) This Regulation does not apply where the premium payable by a consumer may be subject to review as a result of an amendment to the policy requested by the consumer.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
